title: Hush Harbor: Ifé Franklin and DZIDZOR
location: St. Augustine's African Orthodox Church 137 Allston Street Cambridge, MA 02139 Show map
about: Hush harbors were secret meeting places where in enslaved African-Americans would gather to worship, socialize, and maintain Cultural traditions outside of the ever watchful eyes of white society. Ifé Franklin and Dzidzor with support from community members will activate the sanctuary of Saint Augustine African Orthodox Church, creating a space for folks to gather, sing, shout, moan and move and share joy! We need these safe space more than ever for our collective healing, hope and liberation. Participants are welcome to bring an instrument, your voice, to move, dance, or sit in space together. This special event is tailored specially for a participatory audience of Black, Indigenous and people of color (BIPOC) only, as BHAC creates a safe harbor in a challenging time. Our following events are open to all. This event will be followed by a social time including refreshments.
tags: Things to do in Cambridge, MA

title: Концерт памяти Ю. Визбора в Бостоне.
location: John Hancock Hall 180 Berkeley Street Boston, MA 02116 Show map
about: На сцене будут выступать Вениамин Смехов, Сергей Никитин, Алексей и Мария Иващенко, Дмитрий Богданов, Тимур Шаов, Галина и Алексей Хомчики, Артем Лысков и музыканты джазового трио Stellar! Билеты без комиссии так же можно заказать по телефону 617-232-8820. «Разрешите вам напомнить о себе» – так мы назвали добрую беседу с близкими людьми, которые соберутся в этот вечер вместе на сцене и в зале. Мы будем рассказывать друг другу истории, написанные Юрием Визбором, как он рассказывал их сам. Под гитару, но не только. Визбор не был бунтарем, как Высоцкий, или философом, как Окуджава. Скорее как Синатра, певец обычного человеческого существования, наполненного дружбой, добротой и романтикой. Прошлым летом ему исполнилось 90. А в 50 он ушел в лыжной куртке и шапке с помпоном к своим далеким вершинам, оставив нам песни, чтобы не забывали. Мы и не забываем, поем. Заходите вечером в гости, берите с собой друзей и родных. Давайте проведем эти три часа вместе, споем его песни, поговорим, отметим его юбилей. Искренне ваши, Вениамин Смехов, Сергей Никитин, Алексей и Мария Иващенко, Дмитрий Богданов, Тимур Шаов, Галина и Алексей Хомчики, Артем Лысков и музыканты джазового трио Stellar.

title: Keila Wakao Plays Barber
location: First Church in Cambridge 11 Garden Street Cambridge, MA 02138 Show map
about: First prize winner of both the Menuhin International Violin Competition and the Stulburg International String Competition, Keila Wakao is a Boston native currently attending the New England Conservatory of Music. She has performed concertos with orchestras across the United States including the Boston Symphony Orchestra, the Chattanooga Symphony Orchestra, the Eugene Symphony, the Richmond Symphony, the Kalamazoo Symphony Orchestra, the Lexington Symphony, the Baltimore Chamber Orchestra, and many more. She returns to the Apollo Ensemble to perform Barber's Violin Concerto on a program that also features the world premiere of Gala Flagello's Droughts and Downpours for string orchestra and Brahms' 3rd Symphony. The Apollo Ensemble of Boston Elias Miller, Music Director Program: Gala Flagello – Droughts and Downpours (*World Premiere*) Brahms – Symphony No. 3 in F major ~Intermission~ Barber – Violin Concerto (Keila Wakao, Violin) Where: First Church Cambridge 11 Garden Street, Cambridge, Massachusetts 02138 When: April 27th, 2025 at 3:30PM

title: Drag Me To Brunch 8th Anniversary Show - May 4th, 2025
location: Carrie Nation Cocktail Club 11 Beacon Street Boston, MA 02108 Show map
about: The event is going to be a vibrant extravaganza, showcasing the best of drag culture and entertainment. From jaw-dropping performances to fabulous costumes, the show is a feast for the senses. Attendees will be treated to a whirlwind of performances by some of Boston’s most talented drag queens in the business. Each act is filled with energy, humor, and impeccable lip-syncing, captivating the audience from start to finish. From classic diva numbers to contemporary pop hits to group numbers, there is something for everyone to enjoy. But Drag Me to Brunch is more than just a showcase of talent; it's a celebration of diversity, self-expression, and acceptance. The atmosphere is electric, filled with love, support, and a sense of community. It's a place where people can come together to celebrate their differences and revel in the joy of being themselves. And let's not forget about the brunch itself! Attendees are welcome to a delicious breakfast buffet (and new omelet bar) and refreshing drinks, adding to the festive atmosphere of the event. Whether you're a seasoned drag aficionado or new to the scene, Drag Me To Brunch is an experience like no other—a fabulous celebration of all things drag, where fun knows no bounds. IMPORTANT: After ALL tickets for your group have been purchased, please email with the requested information below to reserve a table to ensure your group is seated together via tim@ectgboston.com (Please note this is a family style seating show) STEP 1: Purchase tickets online (Tickets are for reserved seating/general admission) STEP 2: (One person from you party after all tickets are purchased) Email to reserve a table to ensure your group is seated together ( tim@ectgboston.com ) Please include the following information: 1. How many tickets do you have purchased and for which date? 2. What is a name for the reservation? 3. What is a contact number for the reservation? 4. What time did you want to come in? A few reminders: We open our doors at 11am and brunch is served from 11am-12:30pm; which is an additional $25 per person that is added to your tables tab the day of. Show starts at 12pm We will be sitting family style for this show. All seats subject to having a obstructed view. We cannot take more than two credit cards per party and can only split checks into two. No outside food or desserts can be served. Absolutely no decorations of any kind (i.e. balloons or party favors). We have a strict 48-hour refund policy for tickets. (Tickets cannot be transferred to different dates) Tipping the performers is customary; we have plenty of small bills for change. Our show is very interactive. If you do not wish to be included in the show (talked to, pulled on stage, or touched) ask for a glow necklace at check in. We are strictly 21+ Hosted by: Destiny Boston & Dee Dee de Ray

title: 6 ANNUAL MOTHER'S DAY GALA
location: Longwood Venue Destination 60 State Street 33 Floor Boston, MA 02109 Show map
about: **A NIGHT OF EXTRAORDINARY GLAMOUR: QUABIZION FOUNDATION’S MOTHER’S DAY GALA RETURNS TO TRANSFORM GILLETTE STADIUM INTO A BREATHTAKING SANCTUARY** In a notable celebration that has become the crown jewel of Boston’s social calendar, Quabizion Foundation announces its highly anticipated 6th Annual Mother’s Day Gala. On May 11th, the iconic Longwood 33rd floor  offering stunning views of downtown Boston's city lights and harbor will be transformed into a breathtaking sanctuary of elegance, where the nation’s most extraordinary tribute to motherhood will unfold. This distinguished black-tie affair has earned its reputation as a premier Mother’s Day celebration. Where luminaries, visionaries, and cherished members of society gather to honor the very essence of human compassion – our mothers. Each year, this remarkable event surpasses the one before it and 2025 promises an evening that will be etched in the memories of all who attend. Join us for an evening of unparalleled sophistication where gentlemen in refined tuxedos and ladies in sweeping floor-length gowns will grace the red carpet at 5:30 PM. This celebration of maternal love unfolds with exquisite hors d’oeuvres, captivating performances by KLASS, Rutshelle and an exclusive half-show of Heritage by Yole Derose, culminating in a masterfully crafted three-course dinner- all enhanced by the timeless elegance of our crystal-lit grand ballroom. This is more than a gala – it is a profound testament to the unwavering love, sacrifice, and grace of mothers who shape our world. Come indulge in an evening of distinguished elegance, heartfelt tributes, and the kind of magical moments that define generations. Where the World Unites to Honor Mothers – Because Some Celebrations Transcend Ordinary Grace For inquiries about this prestigious gathering, contact: Pelege Marcellin 774-688-5599

title: Side Quest Book Club: Swordheart
location: Side Quest Books & Games 1 Bow Market Way Suite 32 Somerville, MA 02143 Show map
about: The delightful charm of The Princess Bride meets the delicious bodyguard romance of From Blood and Ash in this cozy fantasy romance from New York Times bestselling author T. Kingfisher . Halla has unexpectedly inherited the estate of a wealthy uncle. Unfortunately, she is also saddled with money-hungry relatives full of devious plans for how to wrest the inheritance away from her. While locked in her bedroom, Halla inspects the ancient sword that's been collecting dust on the wall since before she moved in. Out of desperation, she unsheathes it—and suddenly a man appears. His name is Sarkis, he tells her, and he is an immortal warrior trapped in a prison of enchanted steel. Sarkis is sworn to protect whoever wields the sword, and for Halla—a most unusual wielder—he finds himself fending off not grand armies and deadly assassins but instead everything from kindly-seeming bandits to roving inquisitors to her own in-laws. But as Halla and Sarkis grow closer, they overlook the biggest threat of all—the sword itself. ---------------- Tickets for this event are $5, which can be used as $5 credit towards a purchase at SQBG on the day. Side Quest Books & Games is located on the Bow Market balcony, in the back left corner. There is an elevator for accessibility in the lobby of Bow Market, to the right of the driveway when you first arrive. Masks are optional, but please let us know and stay home if you are ill. Outside food and drink are welcome.

title: It's A Queer Date - Boston's Hottest Comedy Dating Show at Club Cafe
location: Club Café 209 Columbus Avenue Boston, MA 02116 Show map
about: "It's A Queer Date" is New England's hottest comedy dating show where four singles take the stage blindfolded and let their charms do the seducing, while the audience throws in deep and spicy questions. Get ready for a night where laughter, mystery, and unexpected sparks collide. Here's how the show works: Before the show kicks off, attendees are invited to a quick mingle session, perfect for meeting new people or enjoying some laughs before the main event. Once the show begins, four singles, who apply ahead of time at the link HERE , take the stage blindfolded for a hilarious and unpredictable blind date, relying on smooth talk and quick wit to spark a connection. The audience fuels the heat by asking bold and flirty questions that nudge the four contestants to reveal their true selves. At the end of the night, the crowd votes to pick out one perfect match couple, who will win a second date outside of the show, planned and paid for by "It's A Queer Date" . Whether it’s steamy, hilarious, awkward or unexpectedly wholesome, "It's A Queer Date" guarantees a night of entertainment where romance and laughter ignite. Anything can happen—and who knows, love just might be in the air. LEGAL DISCLOSURE *By agreeing to purchase a ticket and/or attend the show, you hereby agree to It’s A Date, LLC’s (“It’s A Date”) appearance release and participation agreement. You will be granting It's A Date and all its subsidiaries permission to take motion and still pictures, record your voice and any sound made by you and to use the footage and materials in the development, production, distribution, advertising, and promotions of the show without any monetary compensation to you in perpetuity.

title: aMaSSiT Pitch Session Showings
location: The Dance Complex 536 Massachusetts Avenue Cambridge, MA 02139 Show map
about: About the Pitch Sessions: aMaSSiT presents works in progress by local choreographers through pitch sessions designed to propel them further towards realizing their ambitious dance creations. The pitch session allows the artist to give more information about their aspirations for the project, and outline what they might need to bring their creation into its next phase. Participating artists: Lindsay Gibbons Katherine Marotta Bridget Nicolo Anugraha Raman Alexis Tsiramanes One of the central questions connecting this year's aMaSSiT cohort is " how do I create dance projects that allow me to integrate my whole self? ". Consequently, these artists are developing creative pitches at the intersection of science, health, and their embodied realities. Join us to see what they have been up to, and through your feedback help some form the future of these works. About the aMaSSiT program: aMaSSiT (a M ake it S hare it, S how it lab) is an artist's next deep step in identifying and articulating their unique choreographic voice. The Dance Complex’s aMaSSiT Choreography Lab has evolved to an in-depth curriculum focusing on choreographic tool building and best artistic business practices. This unique program, open to creators in all dance genres, is structured to both foster those early in their careers and to deeply challenge more experienced artists. The 2025 season of aMaSSiT, a collaboration between The Dance Complex and Monkeyhouse , develops tools for building momentum to transform an idea into a larger project. --- The ground level lobby and second floor performance space are ADA compliant. There is a motorized lift that can bring one person at a time from the ground floor to the second floor should a guest wish to use it. There is no elevator. Gender-neutral accessible bathrooms are located on both the ground and second-floor levels of the building.

title: Artisan’s Asylum Speaker Series: Chris Fitch
location: Artisan's Asylum 96 Holton Street Boston, MA 02135 Show map
about: What is “elegance” in mechanical design? As a subjective concept, is it relevant to a field normally focused on technical matters? And if so, how is it embodied in a kinetic object? In this talk, Chris attempts to answer what constitutes an “elegant” design solution to a mechanical problem and why it’s important (to him, anyway). Chris Fitch is a sculptor, engineer and inventor. His prize-winning mechanical sculptures, installations and performance-based artwork have been presented internationally. His puppets and state-of-the art miniature theaters have appeared with major symphony productions in Berlin, London, New York and Los Angeles. His credits for work in animation include Sesame Street, Motorola, Disneyland, and Samsung. Further projects have included the design of a toy factory, independent invention, a tree house bed and breakfast inn in the Philippines, and the development of workshops about kinematics, motion as medium, and foam latex stop motion puppetry. These days he designs industrial robots. More information can be found at www.chrisfitchsculpture.com .

title: Musical Improv Crash Course with Michael Yang
location: The Foundry 101 Rogers Street Cambridge, MA 02142 Show map
about: Ever wonder how some performers can make up entire songs on the spot? Now you can learn how! This workshop is a beginner-friendly introduction to musical improv. In this workshop, you will learn the fundamentals of musical improv, such as song structure and improvising lyrics, and also build comfort with incorporating musical elements into their scene work. This course is best suited to students with at least a foundation of prior improv training, but no prior music/singing background is necessary! About the Instructor Michael is an improviser, music director, and songwriter. He's been active in the greater Boston improv scene for 7 years, having played on stage and on keys with ComedySportz, Dirty Disney, Uncomposed, Nova, and more! He also ran the Somerville Musical Improv jam, where people of all different skill levels came together to play musical improv games and sing songs. In his spare time, he releases indie comedy songs under the name LJY and plays in many D&D games. About the Location This workshop will take place at The Cambridge Foundry in Kendall Square. This workshop will be in the RED MULTIROOM - take a right as soon as you head in the front doors, and you'll see us! If you need help finding your way, The Foundry staff is amazing , and located right inside at the front desk! About The Nova Comedy Collective The Nova Comedy Collective, is a new theater group committed to creating new spaces and shows for the Boston comedy community to flourish. Rising from the ashes of spaces lost to the pandemic, this new collective of comedians and creators is embracing radical hope, limitless fun, and uncompromising inclusivity. Comedy is for everyone. Our mission is to create live shows and other adventures in creativity that are unique, daring, and authentic. We promote belonging and community, encourage collaboration and continuous learning, and celebrate imagination, honesty, and risk-taking. At The Nova Comedy Collective, we’re always laughing with you.

title: Inman Eats & Crafts 2025
location: Inman Square 1310 Cambridge Street Cambridge, MA 02139 Show map
about: The East Cambridge Business Association (ECBA) is proud to present Inman Eats & Crafts 2025 , on Sunday May 18, 2025 from 12:00 noon – 4:00pm . Inman Eats & Crafts will take place on Cambridge Street in Inman Square, between Springfield Street and Prospect Street. Inman Eats & Crafts is a celebration of everything Inman Square. It’s a street fair featuring our eclectic retailers, fabulous makers, our casual eats, and culinary treats. Inman Eats & Crafts hopes to deliver a full Inman Square experience to new visitors and residents alike. Inman Square shops and restaurants will be open for business as usual, but to experience The EATS you will need to purchase Inman Bucks . Inman Bucks are your ticket to try the samplings being offered by restaurant vendors taking part in the event. Inman Bucks can be purchased in advance through Eventbrite or www.EastCambridgeBA.com and are on sale beginning April 21 . Inman Bucks are limited, so advanced purchase is recommended. Inman Bucks will be for sale the day of the event based on availability. Thanks to gather here stitch lounge, East Cambridge Savings Bank , and Industry Labs , Inman Eats & Crafts will be hosting over 45 local makers at our Handmade Marketplace located in the East Cambridge Savings Bank and Industry Lab parking lots. Inman Eats & Crafts is open to all ages and pets. Come listen to local bands, visit our makers, try some local beer, and enjoy tasty food from the best restaurants in town! Live music programmed by The Lilypad, featuring some of your favorite local acts, including The Boston Cowboy Balladeers and more. Enjoy neighborhood brews from Lamplighter Brewing Co., Portico Brewing , and Remnant Brewing at our beer garden. There will also be live T-shirt screen printing with QRST’s and crafts with Alex Makes Art. Many of your favorite local restaurants will be participating. The growing list includes 1369 Coffee House, Christina's Ice Cream, Chomp! Chomp! Smash Burgers, Formaggio Kitchen Kendall, Mamaleh's Delicatessen , New Republick, Oak Bistro , Ole , Puritan Oyster Bar, S&S Delicatessen, and Turing Tavern . Inman Eats & Crafts is a perfect opportunity to get a taste of the local fare in and near East Cambridge and Inman Square. We are proud to partner with our sponsors, Alexandria Real Estate Equities, New England Development, Fairlane Properties, East Cambridge Savings Bank, Naveo Credit Union, Rock & Roll Daycare, Cambridge Savings Bank, Inman Wine and Spirits, and the City of Cambridge, as well as gather here stitch lounge to bring you this event!

title: The Art of Flamenco Guitar with Grisha Goryachev
location: Multicultural Arts Center 41 Second Street Cambridge, MA 02141 Show map
about: Get ready for an unforgettable musical experience at the next Boston GuitarFest, where flamenco guitar virtuoso Grisha Goryachev will take the stage in a rare, not-to-be-missed performance. Renowned for his extraordinary technical mastery and deep emotional expression, Goryachev is one of the most celebrated flamenco guitarists of his generation. With a career spanning multiple continents and accolades, including top honors at international guitar competitions, Goryachev has earned a reputation for pushing the boundaries of flamenco while honoring its rich traditions. Known for his dynamic stage presence and captivating performances, Goryachev's artistry blends virtuosic technique with the soul-stirring intensity of flamenco’s most complex rhythms and melodies. His impeccable command of the guitarra flamenca has earned him rave reviews from critics and audiences alike, with performances at prestigious venues such as the Carnegie Hall , Café de Chinitas in Madrid, and the Santiago de Compostela International Guitar Festival . Whether you're a seasoned flamenco aficionado or a newcomer to the genre, this concert is an unparalleled opportunity to witness one of the world’s leading flamenco guitarists in his element. Don't miss the chance to see Grisha Goryachev bring his unique artistry to the stage at the Boston GuitarFest — an evening of passion, rhythm, and virtuosity that will leave you breathless.

title: Side Quest Book Club: Road to Ruin
location: Side Quest Books & Games 1 Bow Market Way Suite 32 Somerville, MA 02143 Show map
about: An electrifying, gritty fantasy from debut author Hana Lee that takes a royal messenger on a high-speed chase across a climate-ravaged wasteland, featuring motorcycles, monsters, and magic. Jin-Lu has the most dangerous job in the wasteland. She’s a magebike courier, one of the few who venture outside the domed cities on motorcycles powered by magic. Every day, she braves the wasteland’s dangers—deadly storms, roving marauders, and territorial beasts—to deliver her wares. Her most valuable cargo? A prince’s love letters addressed to Yi-Nereen, a princess desperate to escape the clutches of her abusive family and soon-to-be husband. Jin, desperately in love with both her and the prince, can’t refuse Yi-Nereen’s plea for help. The two of them flee across the wastes, pursued by Yi-Nereen’s furious father, her scheming betrothed, and a bounty hunter with mysterious powers. A storm to end all storms is brewing and dark secrets about the heritability of magic are coming to light. Jin’s heart has led her into peril before, but this time she may not find her way back. ---------------- Tickets for this event are $5, which can be used as $5 credit towards a purchase at SQBG on the day. Side Quest Books & Games is located on the Bow Market balcony, in the back left corner. title: THE BIG DUMB STUPID CLOWN WORKSHOP AGAIN!!
location: The Foundry 101 Rogers Street Cambridge, MA 02142 Show map
about: About the Class Let your brain go all soft and your heart swell up big and juicy! Realign with the light, agile, very good, genius clown within! title: Side Quest Book Club: The Butcher of the Forest
location: Side Quest Books & Games 1 Bow Market Way Suite 32 Somerville, MA 02143 Show map
about: A world-weary woman races against the clock to rescue the children of a wrathful tyrant from a dangerous, otherworldly forest. At the northern edge of a land ruled by a monstrous, foreign tyrant lies the wild forest known as the Elmever. The villagers know better than to let their children go near—once someone goes in, they never come back out. No one knows the strange and terrifying traps of the Elmever better than Veris Thorn, the only person to ever rescue a child from the forest many years ago. When the Tyrant’s two young children go missing, Veris is commanded to enter the forest once more and bring them home safe. If Veris fails, the Tyrant will kill her; if she remains in the forest for longer than a day, she will be trapped forevermore. So Veris will travel deep into the Elmever to face traps, riddles, and monsters at the behest of another monster. One misstep will cost everything. ---------------- Tickets for this event are $5, which can be used as $5 credit towards a purchase at SQBG on the day. title: Workshop: Video Installation and Projection Mapping
location: Artisan's Asylum 96 Holton Street Boston, MA 02135 Show map
about: This workshop is for people who want to learn how to integrate video projection mapping with 2D works, sculpture, installation, performance, and public art practices. The workshop will go over projector properties and terms, computer to projector setups, ways of working within the Adobe suite and a basic introduction to MadMapper. Students will work in a hands-on manner live mapping/masking their video content onto items that they bring. If possible, students should bring their own laptops, projectors, and accessories (see full list below), but if you don't have these items, please contact us before enrolling and we can see if we are able to provide things for you. Prerequisites Participants should have a base knowledge of editing in Adobe Premiere or After Effects and have video files to bring to the workshop. What to bring to the workshop: Physical items - Bring 5 or more 3D objects / artworks / materials / substances / etc. to test projections on. Tip/FYI: Transparent surfaces (glass, plastic, etc) will NOT hold projection, something needs to be translucent (like tracing paper) to opaque. Very shiny and mirrors will bounce projection. - Something for note taking (hardcopy or digital) Digital Files - Bring moving image files to test/practice with (raw footage or past work) on a laptop Optional but recommended: Gather/create moving image content that could add meaning to the objects you are going to bring. Not sure? Collect a wide variety of footage (different content, colors, pacing, framing, etc.) - Optional: still images with shapes/images that might be a shape you'd like to project within Equipment Laptop - with display port or other video outs; adaptors as needed to connect your computer to the projector's video cables* - with Adobe Premiere or After Effects loaded. You can get a 7-day free Adobe Premiere trial here. - with MadMapper demo version (limited version with watermarks, free download ) Projector with it's appropriate *video cables (HDMI or other) that can connect to your computer Power - Extension cord - Power strip Optional / Bring if you have it: - Projector stand (with vertical rotation options; tip: bring bungee cords if needed to secure projector at odd angles) or if your projector has a tripod mount: bring a tripod that can support it - Speakers (bluetooth or wired, bring appropriate cables/adaptors) - Various projector shims: pieces of wood, cardboard - Gaffers tape - Cinefoil - Some suggested readings may be sent out before the class to help participants have more conceptual references.

title: May Outdoor Queer Dance Workshop with Michael Winward
location: Granada Park Granada Park Boston, MA Show map
about: Queer Dance Workshops are a chance for queer folks of all identities and experiences to connect through dance. Featuring a rotating roster of teachers and dance styles, these workshops are a time to simply dance around joyfully with other queer people. These special workshops will be held outside near Egleston Square in Jamaica Plain. Our May workshop will feature partner dancing with Michael Winward! J Michael Winward (he/they) is an interdisciplinary artist: dancer, storyteller, organizer: working at the intersection of movement, memoir, memory, and care. Michael is the director of Steps in Time®: an organization that brings social partner dance programs to assisted living & mind care communities. He is a lead coordinator of Dancing Queerly: a platform for LGBTQ+ dance & performance artist support. Michael has a B.A. in Liberal Arts from Bennington College, and an MFA in Interdisciplinary Art from Goddard College. Michael is currently a first year PhD student in the Theatre, Dance & Performance Studies program at Tufts University. Exact location details will be sent to registrants. We have strong ties with the neighborhood community and the workshop neighbors value our safety. Some parking is available. It is about a 10 minute walk from Stony Brook on the Orange Line and near bus stops for busses 42, 22, 44, and 29. There is a question about access needs in registration. In particular, if you need ASL interpretation please note it in your rsvp or email me at jotrolldance@gmail.com as it is often easier to get interpretation with a confirmed need. Unfortunately, I will need at least a week's notice to ensure interpretation. Workshops are free, but please consider donating (no more than $20) to help pay our wonderful teachers.

title: Inman Eats & Crafts 2025
location: Inman Square 1310 Cambridge Street Cambridge, MA 02139 Show map
about: The East Cambridge Business Association (ECBA) is proud to present Inman Eats & Crafts 2025 , on Sunday May 18, 2025 from 12:00 noon – 4:00pm . Inman Eats & Crafts will take place on Cambridge Street in Inman Square, between Springfield Street and Prospect Street. Inman Eats & Crafts is a celebration of everything Inman Square. It’s a street fair featuring our eclectic retailers, fabulous makers, our casual eats, and culinary treats. Inman Eats & Crafts hopes to deliver a full Inman Square experience to new visitors and residents alike. Inman Square shops and restaurants will be open for business as usual, but to experience The EATS you will need to purchase Inman Bucks . Inman Bucks are your ticket to try the samplings being offered by restaurant vendors taking part in the event. Inman Bucks can be purchased in advance through Eventbrite or www.EastCambridgeBA.com and are on sale beginning April 21 . Inman Bucks are limited, so advanced purchase is recommended. Inman Bucks will be for sale the day of the event based on availability. Thanks to gather here stitch lounge, East Cambridge Savings Bank , and Industry Labs , Inman Eats & Crafts will be hosting over 45 local makers at our Handmade Marketplace located in the East Cambridge Savings Bank and Industry Lab parking lots. Inman Eats & Crafts is open to all ages and pets. Come listen to local bands, visit our makers, try some local beer, and enjoy tasty food from the best restaurants in town! Live music programmed by The Lilypad, featuring some of your favorite local acts, including The Boston Cowboy Balladeers and more. Enjoy neighborhood brews from Lamplighter Brewing Co., Portico Brewing , and Remnant Brewing at our beer garden. There will also be live T-shirt screen printing with QRST’s and crafts with Alex Makes Art. Many of your favorite local restaurants will be participating. The growing list includes 1369 Coffee House, Christina's Ice Cream, Chomp! Chomp! Smash Burgers, Formaggio Kitchen Kendall, Mamaleh's Delicatessen , New Republick, Oak Bistro , Ole , Puritan Oyster Bar, S&S Delicatessen, and Turing Tavern . Inman Eats & Crafts is a perfect opportunity to get a taste of the local fare in and near East Cambridge and Inman Square. We are proud to partner with our sponsors, Alexandria Real Estate Equities, New England Development, Fairlane Properties, East Cambridge Savings Bank, Naveo Credit Union, Rock & Roll Daycare, Cambridge Savings Bank, Inman Wine and Spirits, and the City of Cambridge, as well as gather here stitch lounge to bring you this event!

title: Musical Improv Crash Course with Michael Yang
location: The Foundry 101 Rogers Street Cambridge, MA 02142 Show map
about: Ever wonder how some performers can make up entire songs on the spot? Now you can learn how! This workshop is a beginner-friendly introduction to musical improv. In this workshop, you will learn the fundamentals of musical improv, such as song structure and improvising lyrics, and also build comfort with incorporating musical elements into their scene work. This course is best suited to students with at least a foundation of prior improv training, but no prior music/singing background is necessary! About the Instructor Michael is an improviser, music director, and songwriter. He's been active in the greater Boston improv scene for 7 years, having played on stage and on keys with ComedySportz, Dirty Disney, Uncomposed, Nova, and more! He also ran the Somerville Musical Improv jam, where people of all different skill levels came together to play musical improv games and sing songs. In his spare time, he releases indie comedy songs under the name LJY and plays in many D&D games. About the Location This workshop will take place at The Cambridge Foundry in Kendall Square. This workshop will be in the RED MULTIROOM - take a right as soon as you head in the front doors, and you'll see us!
